meanings.definition: To commit a crime again after having been convicted and punished for a previous offense.
meanings.sent1: After serving his time in jail, he hoped he would not reoffend.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was warned not to reoffend after his release.
meanings.sent3: The thief decided to reoffend just for the thrill of it.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to reoffend was like a shadow she couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of reoffending were severe and life-altering.

meanings.definition: To engage in criminal behavior again after a period of abstinence.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts to stay clean, he couldn't resist the urge to reoffend.
meanings.sent2: The ex-convict struggled not to reoffend after being released from prison.
meanings.sent3: The cat burglar joked that he was going to reoffend just for old times' sake.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to reoffend was a step back in her journey towards rehabilitation.
meanings.sent5: The temptation to reoffend lingered in the back of his mind, taunting him.
